Pepper_bell_healthy.solution: Maintain good soil fertility and regular monitoring.
Pepper_bell_healthy.symptoms: Healthy bell pepper plants with no signs of disease.

Potato_Early_blight.solution: Practice crop rotation, remove infected debris, and use resistant potato varieties.
Potato_Early_blight.symptoms: Dark brown spots on leaves with concentric rings, yellowing and leaf drop.

Potato_healthy.solution: Maintain good irrigation and healthy soil conditions.
Potato_healthy.symptoms: Healthy potato plants with no visible issues.

Potato_Late_blight.solution: Remove infected plants, avoid overhead irrigation, and ensure good ventilation.
Potato_Late_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves, dark blight spots, and plant wilting.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.solution: Use disease-free seeds, avoid overhead watering, and apply copper sprays.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark spots on leaves and fruits, surrounded by yellow halos.

Tomato_Early_blight.solution: Crop rotation, remove infected plant debris, and use resistant tomato varieties.
Tomato_Early_blight.symptoms: Concentric rings on leaves, premature leaf drop, and reduced fruit yield.

Tomato_healthy.solution: Ensure optimal growing conditions and regular monitoring.
Tomato_healthy.symptoms: Healthy tomato plants with no signs of disease.

Tomato_Late_blight.solution: Remove infected leaves, improve air circulation, and avoid wet foliage.
Tomato_Late_blight.symptoms: Grayish, water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems, followed by fruit rot.

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.solution: Ensure good ventilation, remove infected leaves, and avoid high humidity.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces and a grayish-purple mold on undersides.

Tomato_mosaic_virus.solution: Remove infected plants, disinfect tools, and use resistant varieties.
Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mosaic-like patterns on leaves, stunted growth, and distorted fruits.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.solution: Remove infected leaves, improve air circulation, and apply fungicides as needed.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Small, circular spots with dark borders and gray centers on leaves.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.pesticide: Miticides such as Abamectin or Neem oil
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.solution: Introduce natural predators like ladybugs, and regularly spray neem oil.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.symptoms: Fine webbing on plants, yellowing leaves, and leaf drop.

Tomato_Target_Spot.solution: Remove infected debris, improve soil drainage, and apply fungicides.
Tomato_Target_Spot.symptoms: Brown lesions on leaves with concentric rings, and fruit rot.

Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.solution: Use resistant varieties, control whitefly populations, and remove infected plants.
Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.symptoms: Yellowing and curling of leaves, stunted growth, and reduced fruit production.
